Package io.github.vecmatlib.matrix

Interface MatrixAsDouble<M extends MatrixDoubleOperations<M,V>,V extends VectorDoubleOperations<V>>

Type Parameters:
M - A double matrix of the same size as this one
V - A vector of the same type as that matrix
All Known Implementing Classes:
Float3x3, Float4x4, Int3x3, Int4x4
public interface MatrixAsDouble<M extends MatrixDoubleOperations<M,V>,V extends VectorDoubleOperations<V>>
Interface to be implemented by a matrix that can be represented as a double matrix without casting.
Author:
Nico

  • Method Details

    • plus

      default M plus(M matrix)
      Computes the sum of this matrix with the given one.

      The sum of two matrices m1 and m2 of the same dimensions is a matrix m3 such that every element m-ij of m3 is the sum of the element m-ij of m1 and the element m-ij of m2.

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      The sum of this matrix and a double matrix is a double matrix.

      Parameters:
      matrix - The second operand of the sum, a double matrix.
      Returns:
      The sum of this matrix and the given one or.
      Throws:
      MatrixMathException - If the matrices have different dimensions.
      NullPointerException - if the given matrix is null.

    • minus

      default M minus(M matrix)
      Computes the subtraction of the given matrix from this one.

      The subtraction of a matrix m2 from a matrix m1 is defined as the sum of m1 with the additive inverse of m2. That is m1 - m2 = m1 + (-m2)

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      The subtraction of this matrix and a double matrix is a double matrix.

      Parameters:
      matrix - The second operand of the subtraction, a double matrix.
      Returns:
      The subtraction of this matrix and the given one.
      Throws:
      MatrixMathException - If the matrices have different dimensions.
      NullPointerException - if the given matrix is null.

    • multipliedBy

      default M multipliedBy(double k)
      Multiplies this matrix with the given scalar.

      The product of a matrix m and a scalar k is a matrix m' such that every element m'-ij is the product of the element m-ij and k.

      The product of this matrix and a double scalar is a double matrix.

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      Parameters:
      k - The scalar to which this matrix is multiplied.
      Returns:
      The product of this matrix and the given scalar.

    • multiply

      default V multiply(V vector)
      Computes the product between this matrix and the given vector.

      The product between a matrix and a vector is the linear combination between all the columns of the matrix and all the elements of the vector.

      The product can also be defined as a vector where every element is the dot product of the corresponding row of the matrix and the vector.

      A vector and a matrix can only be multiplied if the matrix has the same number of columns as the vector has elements.

      The product of this matrix and a double vector is a double vector.

      Parameters:
      vector - The second operand of the product, a double vector.
      Returns:
      The result of the product between this matrix and the given vector.
      Throws:
      MatrixMathException - If the size of the vector does not match the number of columns of this matrix.
      NullPointerException - if the given vector is null.

    • multiply

      default M multiply(M matrix)
      Multiplies this matrix by the given one.

      Two matrices can only be multiplied if the first one has the same number of rows as the second one has columns.

      The product between two matrices m1 and m2 is a matrix m3 such that every element m-ij of m3 is the dot product of the i-th row of m1 and the j-th column of m2.

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      The product of this matrix and a double matrix is a double matrix.

      Parameters:
      matrix - The second operand of the product, a double matrix.
      Returns:
      The product of this matrix and the given one.
      Throws:
      MatrixMathException - If the number of rows of this matrix does not match the number of columns of the given matrix.
      NullPointerException - if the given matrix is null.

    • asDouble

      M asDouble()
      Converts this matrix to a double matrix without casting.
      Returns:
      The double value of this matrix
